experiences.name: British Museum
experiences.desc: World-class collections, free entry, Bloomsbury
experiences.longDesc: A world-spanning collection from Egyptian mummies to the Rosetta Stone, offering endless discovery moments and family audio guides for meaningful exploration.

experiences.name: National Gallery
experiences.desc: Masterpieces, free entry, Trafalgar Square
experiences.longDesc: A world-class art collection from medieval through impressionist periods, with family trails, interactive activities, and free admission to spark artistic curiosity.

experiences.name: Tate Modern
experiences.desc: Modern art with city views, great South Bank pairing
experiences.longDesc: A converted power station bursting with contemporary art, free admission, theatrical installations, and family programs sparking creative thinking.

experiences.name: V&A Museum
experiences.desc: Decorative arts, great caf√© courtyard, free, South Kensington
experiences.longDesc: A vast design museum celebrating decorative arts, fashion, and architecture, with interactive galleries and objects that surprise visitors of all ages.

experiences.name: Natural History Museum
experiences.desc: Dinosaurs + blue whale, classic with kids, free
experiences.longDesc: A stunning Victorian palace filled with dinosaurs, animals, and geological wonders‚Äîthe blue whale and T-Rex skeletons never fail to mesmerize children.

experiences.name: Tower of London
experiences.desc: Crown Jewels, Yeoman Warder tours, book ahead
experiences.longDesc: A dramatic fortress with 1,000 years of history, Crown Jewels that dazzle, and Yeoman Warder stories that bring royal drama vividly alive.

experiences.name: Tower Bridge Walkway
experiences.desc: Iconic bridge, glass floor views, easy with kids
experiences.longDesc: Tower Bridge Walkway provides iconic bridge, glass floor views, easy with kids, offering visitors of all ages wonderful opportunities to explore and learn while creating lasting family memories.

experiences.name: St Paul's Cathedral
experiences.desc: Dome climb for views, iconic architecture, City
experiences.longDesc: St Paul's Cathedral provides dome climb for views, iconic architecture, city, offering visitors of all ages wonderful opportunities to explore and learn while creating lasting family memories.

experiences.name: Westminster Abbey
experiences.desc: Royal coronation site, timed entry, Westminster
experiences.longDesc: An awe-inspiring Gothic cathedral where coronations and royal weddings occur, offering soaring arches, stained glass, and palpable history.

experiences.name: Buckingham Palace
experiences.desc: State Rooms (seasonal), classic London moment
experiences.longDesc: The iconic royal residence with State Rooms open seasonally, offering glimpses of royal interiors, gilded furnishings, and pageantry.

experiences.name: Changing of the Guard
experiences.desc: Free spectacle, arrive early for best views
experiences.longDesc: Changing of the Guard provides free spectacle, arrive early for best views, offering visitors of all ages wonderful opportunities to explore and learn while creating lasting family memories.

experiences.name: London Eye
experiences.desc: Easy skyline views, great first-day orientation
experiences.longDesc: London Eye provides easy skyline views, great first-day orientation, offering visitors of all ages wonderful opportunities to explore and learn while creating lasting family memories.

experiences.name: The View from The Shard
experiences.desc: Highest viewpoint in London, best at sunset
experiences.longDesc: The View from The Shard provides highest viewpoint in london, best at sunset, offering visitors of all ages wonderful opportunities to explore and learn while creating lasting family memories.

experiences.name: Sky Garden
experiences.desc: Free indoor gardens + panoramic views, City

experiences.name: Churchill War Rooms

experiences.name: Cutty Sark

experiences.longDesc: A preserved Victorian tea clipper ship offering glimpses into maritime trade, sailors' life, and 19th-century ocean voyaging.

experiences.name: Hampton Court Palace
experiences.desc: Tudor history, gardens, maze great for kids
experiences.longDesc: Henry VIII's riverside palace with maze gardens, grand interiors, boating, and the dramatic history of Tudor power.

experiences.name: Kensington Palace

experiences.name: Hyde Park & Kensington Gardens

experiences.longDesc: Hyde Park & Kensington Gardens provides playgrounds, seasonal boating, easy stroller time, offering visitors of all ages wonderful opportunities to explore and learn while creating lasting family memories.

experiences.name: Primrose Hill

experiences.name: Hampstead Heath

markets.name: Borough Market
markets.desc: Iconic gourmet market, excellent grab-and-go lunches
markets.longDesc: London's legendary food market with vendors selling fresh produce, artisan foods, ready-to-eat samples, and the energy of a working foodie gathering.

markets.name: Maltby Street Market
markets.desc: Small high-quality weekend street food + bakeries
markets.longDesc: Maltby Street Market offers small high-quality weekend street food + bakeries, where visitors can explore local goods, experience community energy, and discover authentic cultural treasures.

markets.name: Portobello Road Market
markets.desc: Antiques + food, great neighborhood stroll, Notting Hill
markets.longDesc: London's most famous antique market stretching for miles on Saturdays, with vintage treasures, collectibles, and street-food energy.

markets.name: Columbia Road Flower Market
markets.desc: Sunday flowers + coffee + small shops, Bethnal Green
markets.longDesc: A Sunday institution in East London selling exuberant cut flowers, potted plants, antiques, and second-hand finds amid village-like atmosphere.

markets.name: Broadway Market
markets.desc: Saturday food stalls + indie shops, Hackney
markets.longDesc: A gentrified East London street market combining antiques, fashion, food, and the energy of a tight-knit creative neighborhood.

markets.name: Spitalfields Market
markets.desc: Covered market for crafts + food, good in bad weather
markets.longDesc: Spitalfields Market offers covered market for crafts + food, good in bad weather, where visitors can explore local goods, experience community energy, and discover authentic cultural treasures.

markets.name: Camden Market
markets.desc: Huge food options, fun vibe for older kids/teens
markets.longDesc: London's iconic alternative market with punk fashion, vintage clothing, global street food, and the youthful bohemian energy of North London.

markets.name: Leadenhall Market
markets.longDesc: A Victorian covered market in the City selling upmarket delicatessens, wine, and luxury foods in beautiful ironwork setting.

markets.name: Fortnum & Mason Food Hall
markets.longDesc: Fortnum & Mason Food Hall offers luxury hampers, teas, sweets, piccadilly, where visitors can explore local goods, experience community energy, and discover authentic cultural treasures.

markets.name: Harrods Food Halls
markets.desc: Over-the-top food halls, easy lunch, Knightsbridge
markets.longDesc: Harrods Food Halls offers over-the-top food halls, easy lunch, knightsbridge, where visitors can explore local goods, experience community energy, and discover authentic cultural treasures.

markets.name: Greenwich Market
markets.desc: Food + crafts, easy with Greenwich sights
markets.longDesc: A historic covered market featuring antiques, crafts, vintage finds, and food stalls in a charming waterfront neighborhood.

markets.name: Brick Lane Sunday UpMarket
markets.desc: Global street food + vintage browsing, Sundays
markets.longDesc: Brick Lane Sunday UpMarket offers global street food + vintage browsing, sundays, where visitors can explore local goods, experience community energy, and discover authentic cultural treasures.

markets.name: Mercato Mayfair
markets.desc: Food stalls in converted church setting
markets.longDesc: Mercato Mayfair offers food stalls in converted church setting, where visitors can explore local goods, experience community energy, and discover authentic cultural treasures.

markets.name: Marylebone Farmers' Market

markets.longDesc: Marylebone Farmers' Market offers top produce & pastries, sundays, great for park picnic, where visitors can explore local goods, experience community energy, and discover authentic cultural treasures.

markets.name: Selfridges Foodhall

markets.longDesc: Selfridges Foodhall offers strong prepared foods and treats, oxford street, where visitors can explore local goods, experience community energy, and discover authentic cultural treasures.
